name: lisamich.github.io
body:
### Welcome
This is a collection of some of my technical work related to quantitative finance. Homework sets, papers I've authored,  Python programs, and blog posts are all fair game.

### Python in Finance
We use Python in some of our classes, and here is some of my work:
* [Basics notebook](https://github.com/pbenson/qfrm-bootcamp/blob/gh-pages/python-templates/python-basics-notebook-empty.ipynb)
* [Secret notebook](https://github.com/pbenson/qfrm-bootcamp/blob/gh-pages/python-templates/python-secret-notebook-empty.ipynb)

### Python Projects
* [interview practice] (https://github.com/lisamich/qfrm-python/blob/master/python-interview-notebook.ipynb)
* [Black-Scholes-Merton] (https://github.com/lisamich/qfrm-python/blob/master/Finance/python-black-scholes-merton.ipynb)

### About me
I am a graduate student at the University of Michigan, in the [Quantitative Finance and Risk Management](https://lsa.umich.edu/math/graduates/quantitative-finance.html) program. I got my Bachelor Degree in Mathematics from Michigan State University, with a minor in Actuarial Science. I had programming experiences in R, MATLAB and Python. I am interested in quantitative trading and financial modeling.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
